faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

type.en: Course with defence at the end

description.en: The subject lasts throughout the academic year, and in the course of it, a practical project is developed from one's own idea in parallel with the subjects of the curriculum. The project can be carried out individually or as a team. The project must be related to some creative field.
description.et: Aine kestab läbi õppeaasta ning selle käigus arendatakse paralleelselt õppekava ainetega oma ideest välja praktiline projekt. Projekt võib olla läbi viidud individuaalselt või meeskonnana. Projekt peab olema seotud mõne loovvaldkonnaga.

objectives.en: The purpose of the subject is to give the student the opportunity to apply the theoretical and practical experience acquired during the course to a creative project carried out independently.
objectives.et: Aine eesmärk on anda üliõpilasele võimalus õppekava kestel omandatud teoreetilist ning praktilist kogemust ühe iseseisvalt läbi viidud loovprojekti juures rakendada.

learning_outcomes.et: Üliõpilane: *näitab sügavat arusaamist projekti teemaks valitud loovvaldkonna teoreetilisest ja praktilisest kontekstist; *rakendab omandatud uurimismeetodeid, teoreetilist tausta ning valdkondlikku kogemust iseseisvalt ning kriitiliselt; *tõlgendab ja analüüsib kompleksseid praktilisi probleeme ning leiab neile lahendusi; *näitab oskust suhelda selgelt ja veenvalt nii suulises kui kirjalikus vormis; *töötab iseseisvalt, vastutab projekti eest ning juhib ressursse ja aega.

notes.et: The mentoring for the Master's Project is available throughout the program, up to 10 hours per project.

independent_work.et:
A Master's Project is a practically oriented research-based graduation paper aiming to solve a particular problem or topic using specialized knowledge, leading to an applied result. Its body text is approximately 15-30 standard pages (27 000 - 54 000 characters). The master's project consists of two parts:
I) practical part (the project)
II) written part -
1. a theoretical-methodological part
2. documentation of the project work process
3. reflection

description.et:
Key Assessment Criteria
1. Practical Part:
· Evidence of project delivery or progress.
· Application of project management tools and techniques.
· Achievement of goals, KPIs, and meaningful impact.
· Stakeholder management and creation of value propositions.
2. Written Part:
· Comprehensive theoretical-methodological overview.
· Completeness and quality of project documentation.
· Critical reflection with actionable insights.
· Overall structure, coherence, and adherence to guidelines.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

description.et: Eelkaitsmine / Pre-defending, project in progress, presentation in Zoom
Magistriprojekti esitamine / Master project needs to be forwarded to the commission
